intro: Noccaea cilicica, commonly known as Turkish mountain sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and the Middle East. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to alpine climates. It produces small, yellow flowers and has leaves that are often used in local cuisines for their tart flavor. Botanically, it is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
